dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 4267 IH: Commodity Delivery Relief Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. McAllister introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Commodity Exchange Act to provide relief for end users who use physical contracts with volumetric optionality.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Commodity Delivery Relief Act.

section.header: Relief for end users who use physical contracts with volumetric optionality
section.text: Section 1a(47)(B)(ii) of the Commodity Exchange Act (7 U.S.C. 1a(47)(B)(ii)) is amended to read as follows:

clause.text: any purchase or sale of a nonfinancial commodity or security for deferred shipment or delivery, so long as the transaction is intended to be physically settled, including any stand-alone or embedded option for which exercise results in a physical delivery obligation;
